rename.to: onedrive: DirMove integration tests failing with: The bound function binding to 'microsoft.graph.driveItem' does not support the escape function annotation.

issue.title: Regression: Get driveItem returning "The bound function binding to 'microsoft.graph.driveItem' does not support the escape function annotation"

labels.name: ask-to:graph
labels.description: Question for Microsoft Graph, which has its own StackOverflow location for support.

repository.name: onedrive-api-docs
repository.description: Official documentation for the OneDrive API

issue.body:
### Category
- [ ] Question
- [ ] Documentation issue
- [x] Bug

#### Expected or Desired Behavior

Calling getItem with a relative path ID works.

#### Observed Behavior

This call has been working in rclone since August 2018.  The URL pattern was suggested in this issue https://github.com/OneDrive/onedrive-api-docs/issues/908#issuecomment-417488480

Rclone's daily integration tests started failing on 2019-10-24 so I think backwards incompatible code was deployed sometime between 2019-10-23 06:00 UTC and 2019-10-24 05:00 UTC.

The request

```
2019/10/26 09:02:12 DEBUG : HTTP REQUEST (req 0xc0005b6500)
2019/10/26 09:02:12 DEBUG : GET /v1.0/drives/71a96798e7b1d253/items/71A96798E7B1D253!247250:/ HTTP/1.1
Host: graph.microsoft.com
User-Agent: rclone/v1.49.5-DEV
Authorization: XXXX
Accept-Encoding: gzip

```

The response

```
2019/10/26 09:02:12 DEBUG : HTTP RESPONSE (req 0xc0005b6500)
2019/10/26 09:02:12 DEBUG : HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request
Content-Length: 332
Cache-Control: private
Client-Request-Id: c2f36dfd-118a-4f65-a4f9-407fb41b4bd6
Content-Type: application/json
Date: Sat, 26 Oct 2019 08:02:11 GMT
Request-Id: c2f36dfd-118a-4f65-a4f9-407fb41b4bd6
Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000
X-Ms-Ags-Diagnostic: {"ServerInfo":{"DataCenter":"UK South","Slice":"SliceC","Ring":"5","ScaleUnit":"002","RoleInstance":"AGSFE_IN_0"}}

{
  "error": {
    "code": "BadRequest",
    "message": "The request URI is not valid. The bound function binding to 'microsoft.graph.driveItem' does not support the escape function annotation.",
    "innerError": {
      "request-id": "c2f36dfd-118a-4f65-a4f9-407fb41b4bd6",
      "date": "2019-10-26T08:02:12"
    }
  }
}
```

#### Steps to Reproduce

Calling the above rest API reproduces the effect.

It is very easy to replicate in rclone - renaming an existing directory will produce the problem.

Here is how I made the error trace above

    rclone move onedrive:rclone-test-cuyejuj7tevutis1tifeleq1/ onedrive:rclone-test-cuyejuj7tevutis1tifeleq2/ -vv --dump bodies --low-level-retries 1 --retries 1

See also: https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/3664

body:
I managed to replicate this with

    rclone move onedrive:rclone-test-cuyejuj7tevutis1tifeleq1/ onedrive:rclone-test-cuyejuj7tevutis1tifeleq2/ -vv --dump bodies --low-level-retries 1 --retries 1

So I reported it as an upstream regression https://github.com/OneDrive/onedrive-api-docs/issues/1177

This is unfortunate timing as I'm just about to release the 1.50 release.

However I think there is a good chance this is a regression at OneDrive that Microsoft will fix.  If not then we can issue a point release with a fix.

rename.from: onedrive: DirMove integration tests failing with: The bound function binding to 'microsoft.graph.driveItem' does not support the escape function annotation.
rename.to: onedrive: DirMove failing with: The bound function binding to 'microsoft.graph.driveItem' does not support the escape function annotation.

body: This is weird... And the error message doesn't make sense to me. I think we can wait for a while for a upstream response first and I'll pay attention to it.

> This is weird... And the error message doesn't make sense to me.

No me neither!

> I think we can wait for a while for a upstream response first and I'll pay attention to it.

:+1:

Did some testing and it seems OneDrive is not quite happy with the trailing slash in the request that reads the metadata of an item by its ID. i.e.

```
GET /v1.0/drives/<DRIVEID>/items/<ITEMID>:/
```

gives 400, but 

```
GET /v1.0/drives/<DRIVEID>/items/<ITEMID>:
```

is okay. I'm still running the tests with this workaround now and they are passing so far...

EDIT: This corresponds to:

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/378a3f41338baf9c479b18abdc402b76620cb5e7/backend/onedrive/onedrive.go#L355

issue.title: onedrive: no trailing slash reading metadata

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
This should fix #3664.

<!--
Thank you very much for contributing code or documentation to rclone! Please
fill out the following questions to make it easier for us to review your
changes.

You do not need to check all the boxes below all at once, feel free to take
your time and add more commits. If you're done and ready for review, please
check the last box.
-->

#### What is the purpose of this change?

Onedrive API is not happy with the trailing slash when reading metadata given item ID. So let's remove it.

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

#3664

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-pull-request).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)
